intro: Leandra hirta var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf leandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
